edu.caltech.nanodb.relations

Class TableSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.caltech.nanodb.relations.Schema
      • edu.caltech.nanodb.relations.TableSchema
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterable<ColumnInfo>

    public class TableSchema
extends Schema
    This class extends the Schema class with features specific to tables, such as the ability to specify primary-key, foreign-key, and other candidate-key constraints, indexes on columns, and so forth.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ArrayList<KeyColumnRefs> candidateKeys
      A collection of candidate-key objects specifying the sets of columns that comprise candidate keys on this table.
      private ArrayList<ForeignKeyColumnRefs> foreignKeys
      A collection of foreign-key objects specifying other tables that this table references.
      private HashMap<String,ColumnRefs> indexes
      This collection provides easy access to all the indexes defined on this table, including those for candidate keys and the primary key.
      private HashSet<Integer> notNullCols
      A set recording which columns have NOT NULL constraints on them
      private KeyColumnRefs primaryKey
      This object specifies the primary key on this table.

    • Field Detail

      • primaryKey

        private KeyColumnRefs primaryKey
        This object specifies the primary key on this table. This key is not also included in the candidateKeys collection.

      • notNullCols

        private HashSet<Integer> notNullCols
        A set recording which columns have NOT NULL constraints on them

      • candidateKeys

        private ArrayList<KeyColumnRefs> candidateKeys
        A collection of candidate-key objects specifying the sets of columns that comprise candidate keys on this table. This collection does not include the primary key specified by the primaryKey field.

      • foreignKeys

        private ArrayList<ForeignKeyColumnRefs> foreignKeys
        A collection of foreign-key objects specifying other tables that this table references.

      • indexes

        private HashMap<String,ColumnRefs> indexes
        This collection provides easy access to all the indexes defined on this table, including those for candidate keys and the primary key.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableSchema

        public TableSchema()

    • Method Detail

      • addNotNull

        public boolean addNotNull(int colIndex)
        Adds a column with given index to list of NOT NULL constrained columns.
        Parameters:
        colIndex - the integer index of the column to NOT NULL constrain.
        Returns:
        true if the column previous was NULLable, or false if the column already had a NOT NULL constraint on it before this call.

      • removeNotNull

        public boolean removeNotNull(int colIndex)
        Removes a column with given index from the list of NOT NULL constrained columns.
        Parameters:
        colIndex - the integer index of the column to remove the NOT NULL constraint from.

      • getNotNull

        public Set<Integer> getNotNull()
        Returns a set of columns that have a NOT NULL constraint, specified by the indexes of the columns in the table schema.
        Returns:
        set of integers - indexes of columns with NOT NULL constraint

      • setPrimaryKey

        public void setPrimaryKey(KeyColumnRefs pk)
        Sets the primary key on this table.
        Parameters:
        pk - the primary key to set on the table, or null if the table has no primary key.

      • getPrimaryKey

        public KeyColumnRefs getPrimaryKey()
        Returns the primary key on this table, or null if there is no primary key.
        Returns:
        the primary key on this table, or null if there is no primary key.

      • getCandidateKeys

        public List<KeyColumnRefs> getCandidateKeys()

      • hasKeyOnColumns

        public boolean hasKeyOnColumns(ColumnRefs k)
        This helper function returns true if this table has a primary or candidate key on the set of columns specified in the argument k. This method is used to determine if a foreign key references a candidate key on this table.
        Parameters:
        k - the key to check against this table to see if it's a candidate key
        Returns:
        true if this table contains a primary or candidate key on the columns specified in k

      • getKeyOnColumns

        public KeyColumnRefs getKeyOnColumns(ColumnRefs k)

      • getAllKeysOnColumns

        public List<KeyColumnRefs> getAllKeysOnColumns(ColumnRefs k)

        public int numForeignKeys()

      • getForeignKeys

        public List<ForeignKeyColumnRefs> getForeignKeys()

      • getIndexes

        public Map<String,ColumnRefs> getIndexes()

      • getIndex

        public ColumnRefs getIndex(String indexName)

      • getIndexNames

        public Set<String> getIndexNames(List<String> columnNames)
        Given a set of column names, this method returns the names of all indexes built on these columns.
        Parameters:
        columnNames - the names of columns to test for
        Returns:
        a set of index names built on the specified columns
